newsitem.title: USA: CBOE looks into trading in options.
newsitem.headline: CBOE looks into trading in options.

text.p: The Chicago Board Options Exchange (CBOE) said it was making a "routine inquiry" into trading in option contracts on shares of Intuit Inc.
"CBOE is conducting a routine inquiry into trading of Intuit options," a CBOE spokesman said without elaborating.

The options saw heavy turnover on Wednesday as the underlying stock jumped seven to 36-1/2, also on hefty volume, amid rumors that American Express Co would bid for Intuit, the maker of the popular Quicken financial software for personal comuputers.
Both companies declined to comment on the rumor.

Intuit November 35 call options had turnover of 2,317 contracts, with premium skyrocketting to 3-3/8 from a previous close of 3/16. Prior to Wednesday's session, the contract had open interest of 216 contracts after last trading on October 24, according to time and sales data.
CBOE routinely looks into trading activity when options on a stock have unusually high volume.
